DataElement.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Injury Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a patient has had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or traumatic injury within 28 days of entry.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Injury Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study by having had a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue or damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had a major s
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days of entry, or is there anticipation of a need for major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to the first date of Bevacizumab therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had surgery (including open biopsy) within 4 weeks prior to anticipated first dose of bevacizumab (allowing for the fact that bevacizumab can be omitted from first cycle of chemotherapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within the past 28 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Major surgical procedures, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury <=28 days prior to randomization or anticipation of need for elective or planned major surgical procedure during the course of the study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient undergone a major surgical procedure, open biopsy or incurred a significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to the first date of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to the first date of treatment on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury <=28 days prior to registration or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the course of the study

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had major surgical procedure, laparoscopic procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within the indicated period

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had, or anticipate to have, any of the following invasive procedures: major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to the first date of dalantercept therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had major surgery within 3 months of the first dose of cabozantinib, if there were no wound healing complications, or within 6 months of the first dose of cabozantinib, if there were wound complications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any major surgeries or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days of treatment start date?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 10 days of the first day of study drug dosing, and minor surgery within 7 days of the first day of study drug dosing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text14
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of major surgery

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to the first date of treatment on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient undergone major surgery, excluding diagnostic biopsy, within 30 days (to allow for full recovery) prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days of treatment start date of Bevacizumab therapy (cycle 2)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to step 2 registration (with the exception of the craniotomy for surgical resection)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury less than 3 weeks or minor surgical procedures (e.g., core biopsy or fine needle aspiration) within 1 week from first dose of first study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to registration (with the exception of the craniotomy for surgical resection)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had or is planning to have any of the indicated invasive procedures within the specified time frames

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient have a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting cediranib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had surgery within 7 days of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient being enrolled within 36 days of definitive diagnostic surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have or plan to have invasive procedures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to the anticipated Cycle 1, Day 1

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known need for a major surgical procedure  within 14 days of starting Ribociclib and Everolimus?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed since surgery prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure within 2 weeks prior to the anticipated start date of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient being enrolled and projected to begin protocol therapy no later than 36 days after definitive diagnostic surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1701 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had major surgery (excluding skin biopsies and procedures for insertion of central venous access devices) within 4 weeks prior to start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a major surgical procedure within 21 days prior to registration or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the course of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure within 4 weeks prior to the anticipated start date of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient being enrolled and is protocol therapy projected to begin within 31 days of definitive diagnostic surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure, other than for diagnosis, within 4 weeks prior to study enrollment, or the anticipation of the need for a major surgical procedure during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient undergone any major surgical procedures within 30 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have diagnostic surgery for GBM within 7 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to registration, or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the study?
